original_solution_mapping.L1: Through March, Dr. Banks gave out 53 + 67 + 46 = <<53+67+46=166>>166 toothbrushes.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Before giving away toothbrushes in April, he had 330 -166 = <<330-166=164>>164 toothbrushes remaining.
original_solution_mapping.L3: Between April and May, he gave out the remaining 164 / 2 = <<164/2=82>>82 toothbrushes each month.
original_solution_mapping.L4: Dr. Banks gave 82 toothbrushes in his busiest month and 46 toothbrushes during the slowest month.
original_solution_mapping.L5: The difference would be 82- 46 = <<82-46=36>>36 more toothbrushes in the busiest month.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4747.
    Returns: the difference in toothbrushes given out between the busiest and slowest months.
    """
    # L1
    january_giveaway = 53 # 53 toothbrushes in January
    february_giveaway = 67 # 67 toothbrushes in February
    march_giveaway = 46 # 46 toothbrushes in March
    total_given_through_march = january_giveaway + february_giveaway + march_giveaway

    # L2
    initial_toothbrushes = 330 # 330 toothbrushes to give away
    remaining_before_april = initial_toothbrushes - total_given_through_march

    # L3
    months_remaining_division = 2 # half each month
    giveaway_per_month_april_may = remaining_before_april / months_remaining_division

    # L5
    difference_busiest_slowest = giveaway_per_month_april_may - march_giveaway

    # FA
    answer = difference_busiest_slowest
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Through March, Dr. Banks gave out {january_giveaway} + {february_giveaway} + {march_giveaway} = <<{january_giveaway}+{february_giveaway}+{march_giveaway}={total_given_through_march}>>{total_given_through_march} toothbrushes.

Before giving away toothbrushes in April, he had {initial_toothbrushes} -{total_given_through_march} = <<{initial_toothbrushes}-{total_given_through_march}={remaining_before_april}>>{remaining_before_april} toothbrushes remaining.

Between April and May, he gave out the remaining {remaining_before_april} / {months_remaining_division} = <<{remaining_before_april}/{months_remaining_division}={giveaway_per_month_april_may}>>{giveaway_per_month_april_may} toothbrushes each month.

The difference would be {giveaway_per_month_april_may}- {march_giveaway} = <<{giveaway_per_month_april_may}-{march_giveaway}={difference_busiest_slowest}>>{difference_busiest_slowest} more toothbrushes in the busiest month.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Before giving away toothbrushes in April, he had 330 -166 = <<330-166=164>>164 toothbrushes remaining.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: Between April and May, he gave out the remaining 164 / 2 = <<164/2=82>>82 toothbrushes each month.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'january_giveaway' (53) was used instead of 'march_giveaway' (46).
